verbs.description: drabble (third-person singular simple present drabbles, present participle drabbling, simple past and past participle drabbled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To wet or dirty, especially by dragging through mud.
(intransitive) To fish with a long line and rod.

description: From a word game in Monty Python's Big Red Book in which the first player to write a novel wins; the UK Science Fiction fandom agreed that 100 words will suffice; not, as is sometimes stated, from the surname of the author Margaret Drabble.

entries.meaning: A short fictional story, typically in fan fiction, sometimes exactly 100 words long.
